data.title: Arizona Christian University (105899)
data.meta_description: Arizona Christian University (105899) is a higher education institution located in Maricopa County, AZ. In 2022, the most popular Bachelors Degree concentrations at Arizona Christian University (105899) were General Business Administration & Management (44 degrees awarded), Counseling Psychology (16 degrees), and US Government & Politics (15 degrees).
data.text:
In 2022, the cost of tuition at Arizona Christian University (105899) was $29,850. The cost of tuition at Arizona Christian University (105899) is $1,520 more than than the overall (public and private) national average for Baccalaureate Colleges ($28,330).

In 2022 Arizona Christian University (105899) had an average net price — the price paid after factoring in grants and loans — of $28,755. Between 2021 and 2022, the average net price of Arizona Christian University (105899) grew by 11.3%.

The average yearly cost of room and board at Arizona Christian University (105899) was of $11,500 in 2022. The cost of room and board did not change between 2021 and 2022.

During the same period, the average yearly cost of books and supplies was $1,600. The cost of books and supplies did not change during the same period.

92% of undergraduate students at Arizona Christian University (105899) received financial aid through grants or loans in 2022. This represents a decline of 2.13% with respect to 2021, when 94% of undergraduate students received financial aid.

The average award discount is the ratio between the average grant or scholarship value, and the cost, which is the sum of out-of-state tuition, room, board, book, supplies, and other expenses.

A cohort default rate is the percentage of a school's borrowers who enter repayment on certain Federal Family Education Loan (FFEL) Program or William D. Ford Federal Direct Loan (Direct Loan) Program loans during a particular federal fiscal year (FY), October 1 to September 30, and default or meet other specified conditions prior to the end of the second following fiscal year.

In 2022, the undergraduate acceptance rate of Arizona Christian University (105899) was 70.1% (923 admissions from 1,316 applications). This is lower than the acceptance rate of 2021, which was 75.9%. Between 2021 and 2022, the number of applicants grew by 7.69%, while admissions declined by 0.539%.

This chart compares the acceptance rate of Arizona Christian University (105899) (in red) with that of other similar universities, and the chart below shows the acceptance rate by gender.

The following chart shows the average SAT scores for the 25th, 50th, and 75th percentile of applicants for each section of the test that they are evaluated on.

The total enrollment at Arizona Christian University (105899) in 2022, both undergraduate and graduate, is 1,082 students. The full-time enrollment at Arizona Christian University (105899) is 933 and the part-time enrollment is 149. This means that 86.2% of students enrolled at Arizona Christian University (105899) are enrolled full-time compared with N/A% at similar Baccalaureate Colleges.

Retention rate measures the number of first-time students who began their studies the previous fall and returned to school the following fall. The retention rate for full-time undergraduates at Arizona Christian University (105899) was 60%. Compared with the full-time retention rate at similar Baccalaureate Colleges (72%), Arizona Christian University (105899) had a retention rate lower than its peers.

The enrolled student population at Arizona Christian University (105899) is 49.4% White, 26.1% Hispanic or Latino, 10.3% Black or African American, 6.84% Two or More Races, 1.66% Asian, 1.48% American Indian or Alaska Native, and 0.647% Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islanders. This includes both full-time and part-time students as well as graduate and undergraduates. By comparison, enrollment for all Baccalaureate Colleges is 54.3% White, 13.8% Hispanic or Latino, and 13.1% Black or African American.

Any student who is studying in the United States on a temporary basis is categorized as a "Non-Resident Alien", and the share of those students are shown in the chart below. Additionally, 6 students (0.555%) did not report their race.

The most common jobs for people who hold a degree in one of the 5 most specialized majors at Arizona Christian University (105899) are Elementary & middle school teachers (1,768,282 people), Secondary school teachers (542,189 people), Physicians (459,921 people), Other managers (455,974 people), and Lawyers, & judges, magistrates, & other judicial workers (403,813 people).

The highest paying jobs for people who hold a degree in one of the 5 most specialized majors at Arizona Christian University (105899) are Surgeons, Nuclear medicine technologists and medical dosimetrists, Securities, commodities, & financial services sales agents, Physicians, and Cardiovascular technologists and technicians

The most common industries for people who hold a degree in one of the 5 most specialized majors at Arizona Christian University (105899) are Elementary & secondary schools (3,308,258 people), Colleges, universities & professional schools, including junior colleges (788,390 people), General medical and surgical hospitals, and specialty (except psychiatric and substance abuse) hospitals (787,233 people), Legal services (337,466 people), and Outpatient care centers (311,779 people).

In 2022, 80 degrees were awarded to men at Arizona Christian University (105899), which is 1.27 times more than the number of degrees awarded to females (63).

In 2022, 38% of students graduating from Arizona Christian University (105899) completed their program within 100% "normal time" (i.e. 4 years for a 4-year degree). Comparatively, 44% completed their degrees within 150% of the normal time, and 44% within 200%.

Graduation rate is defined as the percentage of full-time, first-time students who received a degree or award within a specific percentage of "normal time" to completion for their program.

The student demographic with the highest graduation rate in 2022 at Arizona Christian University (105899) is Female and Two or More Races (100% graduation rate). Across all Baccalaureate Colleges, Asian Female students have the highest graduation rate (73.2%).

The department of education defines graduation rate as the percentage of full-time, first-time students who received a degree or award within 150% of "normal time" to completion.

The National Center for Education Statistics (NCES) categorizes any student who is studying in the United States on a temporary basis as a "Non-Resident Alien", and the graduation rate of those students is shown in the chart below. Additionally, 6.9% of graduates (4 students) did not report their race.

The most common race/ethnicity at Arizona Christian University (105899) is white (66 degrees awarded). There were 1.61 times more white recipients than the next closest race/ethnicity group, hispanic or latino (41 degrees).

The most common race/ethnicity and sex grouping at Arizona Christian University (105899) is white male (42 degrees awarded). There were 1.75 times more white male recipients than the next closest race/ethnicity group, white female (24 degrees).

In 2022, Arizona Christian University (105899) paid a median of $10.5M in salaries, which represents 40.1% of their overall expenditure ($26.1M) and a 8.36% growth from the previous year. This is compared to a 17.2% growth between 2020 and 2021, and a 20.7% growth between 2019 and 2020.

In 2022, the most common positions for instructional staff at Arizona Christian University (105899) were Associate professor with 13 employees, Assistant professor with 10 employees, and Instructor with 7 employees.

In 2022, the most common positions for non-instructional staff at Arizona Christian University (105899) were Community, Social Service, Legal, Arts, Design, Entertainment, Sports and Media with 45 employees, Service with 19 employees, and Office and Administrative Support with 16 employees.
